alert.note: Alert for Eastern Box Elder County; Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Weber... Box Elder...northwestern Davis and northwestern Tooele Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 613 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Park Valley to 12 miles southwest of Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway to 8 miles southeast of Utah Test and Training Range North to 6 miles north of Knolls. There is also a strong thunderstorm north of Bonneville Salt Flats. Movement for all of these storms was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Snowville, Howell, Park Valley, Delle, Utah Test and Training Range North, Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway, Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway, Hat Island, Promontory, Standrod, Penrose, Lynn, Gunnison Island, Bonneville Salt Flats, Locomotive Springs, Lakeside, Curlew Junction, Rosette and Golden Spike Historic Site. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on the Great Salt Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 84 between mile markers 0 and 29. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 5 and 76. Utah Route 30 between mile markers 24 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Box Elder County; Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front
